plot: Mr Burns is sent to prison for art theft, where a scary inmate introduces him to religion. Meanwhile Smithers becomes the boss at the plant, and Bart and Lisa try to share an ant farm.

When Homer, Lenny and Carl get drunk at Mr. Burns' picnic, the police are forced to come to take them away. But, when Lou recognizes a priceless painting on the wall, the careless billionaire is sent to prison where a strong inmate releases his evilness. Meanwhile, Smithers becomes boss of the Power Plant and soon becomes worse than Burns. Homer, Lenny and Carl then try to bust him out. Also, Bart and Lisa try their to take care of the last ant from their ant farm.

When the police are called to diffuse a rowdy crowd at Mr. Burns' estate, one of the officers recognizes priceless stolen paintings on the walls, and the maniacal billionaire is taken downtown for questioning. With Mr. Burns gone, Smithers takes charge of the power plant. But when employees take advantage of his good nature, he exacts revenge by forcing the employees to work night and day. These unfair working conditions prompt Homer and his crew to devise a plan to bust out Mr. Burns.—Fox Publicity
